content.description:
Start on the low section of the crack and then follow the crack to the top.

NOTE: Watch out for loose rock on this route, as the area is known to have some chossy areas.
content.protection: trees for anchor above, rope, and a trad rack
content.location: Right of Hellfire Waltz in the obvious vertical crack.

content.description: Start in the same crack as Crimson Valkyrie, left of the cave shelter. When you get to the ledge half way through the climb, continue up the right side of the flat face.
content.location: Walk up the low section of rock to the crack, left of the cave shelter.

content.description: Start in the crack right of the cave and continue up using underclings until you reach the end. Move up to the shelf/rail and continue up to the left for the top out.
content.protection: Trees for anchors above and a trad rack
content.location: There is a small cave / shelter that someone built at one point or another and Hellfire Waltz is outside the cave entrance, overhead in the large crack.

content.description: Start in the crack to the left of the shelter cave and continue up to the ledge. From there, continue up to the left for the top out.
content.protection: Trees for anchors above and a trad rack
content.location: Start to the left of the shelter cave. Walk up the low section of rock to the crack, which is the start for Crimson Valkyrie.

content.description: The rock quality on the Hellfire Walls ranges from chossy to great depending on the sections you are climbing on.
